basics.name: Zach Parris
basics.label: Software Developer
basics.summary: Fourth generation jeweler turned software developer, diehard student of Nashville Software School. Always looking for a challenge, with a passion for learning, I’m extremely open-minded and curious. I love building/fixing things and solving problems with simple and efficient solutions. Raised in Texas, I’m a fourth generation jeweler by trade. Building and fixing things is what I do best. After almost a decade of working on jewelry, I found myself disinterested and looking for a new endeavor. That’s when I sought out Nashville Software School. With no prior experience, to say I was overwhelmed would be an understatement, but the more immersed I became the more I realized coding was my calling. Through this course I have found my passion in software development, and have completely submerged myself in it. I'm thoroughly enjoying meeting people in the Nashville tech community and look forward to continuing my journey and improving my skills as a developer!

work.summary: Intensive twelve month software development bootcamp C#/.Net development fundamentals and problem solving.
highlights: Daily hands on application of OOP fundamentals through group and individual projects.
A full year of experience using Git, Bower, and NPM

projects.name: CorkBoard
projects.summary: An ASP.NET MVC (C#) app designed to help user keep track and share favorite wines

projects.name: PitStop
projects.summary: A jewelry repair intake form, utilizing AngularJS w/ Materialize and Firebase
